   20: 
   21: -module(time_SUITE).
   22: -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function, {erlang,now,0}}).
   23: 
   24: %% "Time is on my side." -- The Rolling Stones
   25: 
   26: %% Tests the BIFs:
   27: %%	erlang:localtime_to_universaltime/1
   28: %%	erlang:universaltime_to_localtime/1
   29: %%	date/0
   30: %%	time/0
   31: %%	now/0
   32: %%
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   35: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, univ_to_local/1, local_to_univ/1,
   36: 	 bad_univ_to_local/1, bad_local_to_univ/1,
   37: 	 univ_to_seconds/1, seconds_to_univ/1,
   38: 	 consistency/1,
   39: 	 now_unique/1, now_update/1, timestamp/1,
   40: 	 time_warp_modes/1,
   41: 	 monotonic_time_monotonicity/1,
   42: 	 monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel/1,
   43: 	 time_unit_conversion/1,
   44: 	 signed_time_unit_conversion/1,
   45: 	 erlang_timestamp/1,
   46:          native_time_unit_gh6165/1]).
   47: 
   48: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   49: 
   50: -export([local_to_univ_utc/1]).
   51: 
   52: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   53: 
   54: -export([linear_time/1]).
   55: 
   56: %% The following defines the timezone in which the test is run.
   57: %% It is interpreted as the number of hours to be added to UTC
   58: %% to obtain the local time.  The number will be positive east
   59: %% of Greenwhich, negative west of Greenwhich.
   60: %%
   61: %% Allowable range is -12 through 11.
   62: 
   63: -define(timezone, 1).
   64: 
   65: %% Similarly to timezone, but the difference when Daylight Saving Time
   66: %% is in use.  [Same range.]
   67: 
   68: -define(dst_timezone, 2).
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   71:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
   72: 
   73: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   74:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   75: 
   76: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   77: 
   78: all() -> 
   79:     [univ_to_local, local_to_univ, local_to_univ_utc,
   80:      bad_univ_to_local, bad_local_to_univ, 
   81:      univ_to_seconds, seconds_to_univ,
   82:      consistency,
   83:      {group, now}, timestamp,
   84:      time_warp_modes,
   85:      monotonic_time_monotonicity,
   86:      monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel,
   87:      time_unit_conversion,
   88:      signed_time_unit_conversion,
   89:      erlang_timestamp,
   90:      native_time_unit_gh6165].
   91: 
   92: groups() -> 
   93:     [{now, [], [now_unique, now_update]}].
   94: 
   95: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   96:     Config.
   97: 
   98: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   99:     ok.
  100: 
  101: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  102:     Config.
  103: 
  104: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: 
  108: %% Test that DST = true on timezones without DST is ignored
  109: local_to_univ_utc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  110:     case os:type() of
  111: 	{unix,_} ->
  112: 	    %% TZ variable has a meaning
  113: 	    {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-env", "TZ", "UTC"]),
  114: 	    {{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}} =
  115: 		rpc:call(Node,
  116: 			 erlang,localtime_to_universaltime,
  117: 			 [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}},
  118: 			  false]),
  119: 	    {{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}} =
  120: 		rpc:call(Node,
  121: 			 erlang,localtime_to_universaltime,
  122: 			 [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}},
  123: 			  true]),
  124: 	    [{{2008,8,1},{0,0,0}}] =
  125: 		rpc:call(Node,
  126: 			 calendar,local_time_to_universal_time_dst,
  127: 			 [{{2008, 8, 1}, {0, 0, 0}}]),
  128: 	    peer:stop(Peer);
  129: 	_ ->
  130: 	    {skip,"Only valid on Unix"}
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: 
  134: %% Tests conversion from universal to local time.
  135: %% These cases are currently implemented only for MET and fail in
  136: %%  all other timezones
  137: is_stockholm_time() ->
  138:     case os:type() of
  139:         {win32, _} -> case os:cmd("tzutil /g") of
  140:                           "W. Europe Standard Time"++_ -> true;
  141:                           _ -> false
  142:                       end;
  143:         {unix, _} -> case os:cmd("date '+%Z'") of
  144:                           "ME"++_ -> true; %% covers MET/MEST
  145:                           "CE"++_ -> true; %% covers CET/CEST
  146:                           _ -> false
  147:                       end
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: univ_to_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  151:     case is_stockholm_time() of
  152:         true -> test_univ_to_local(test_data());
  153:         false -> {skip, "This test is only valid for Stockholm timezone"}
  154:     end.
  155: 
  156: test_univ_to_local([{Utc, Local}|Rest]) ->
  157:     io:format("Testing ~p => ~p~n", [Local, Utc]),
  158:     Local = erlang:universaltime_to_localtime(Utc),
  159:     test_univ_to_local(Rest);
  160: test_univ_to_local([]) ->
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: %% Tests conversion from local to universal time.
  164: 
  165: local_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     case is_stockholm_time() of
  167:         true -> test_local_to_univ(test_data());
  168:         false -> {skip, "This test is only valid for Stockholm timezone"}
  169:     end.
  170: 
  171: test_local_to_univ([{Utc, Local}|Rest]) ->
  172:     io:format("Testing ~p => ~p~n", [Utc, Local]),
  173:     Utc = erlang:localtime_to_universaltime(Local),
  174:     test_local_to_univ(Rest);
  175: test_local_to_univ([]) ->
  176:     ok.
  177: 
  178: %% Test bad arguments to erlang:universaltime_to_localtime; should
  179: %% generate a badarg.
  180: 
  181: bad_univ_to_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  182:     bad_test_univ_to_local(bad_dates()).
  183: 
  184: bad_test_univ_to_local([Utc|Rest]) ->
  185:     io:format("Testing ~p~n", [Utc]),
  186:     case catch erlang:universaltime_to_localtime(Utc) of
  187: 	      {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> bad_test_univ_to_local(Rest)
  188: 	  end;
  189: bad_test_univ_to_local([]) ->
  190:     ok.
  191: 
  192: %% Test bad arguments to erlang:localtime_to_universaltime/1; should
  193: %% generate a badarg.
  194: 
  195: bad_local_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     bad_test_local_to_univ(bad_dates()).
  197: 
  198: bad_test_local_to_univ([Local|Rest]) ->
  199:     io:format("Testing ~p~n", [Local]),
  200:     case catch erlang:localtime_to_universaltime(Local) of
  201: 	      {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> bad_test_local_to_univ(Rest)
  202: 	  end;
  203: bad_test_local_to_univ([]) ->
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: 
  207: %% Test universaltime to seconds conversions
  208: univ_to_seconds(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  209:     test_univ_to_seconds(ok_utc_seconds()).
  210: 
  211: test_univ_to_seconds([{Datetime, Seconds}|DSs]) ->
  212:     io:format("universaltime = ~p -> seconds = ~p", [Datetime, Seconds]),
  213:     Seconds = erlang:universaltime_to_posixtime(Datetime),
  214:     test_univ_to_seconds(DSs);
  215: test_univ_to_seconds([]) -> 
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %% Test seconds to universaltime conversions
  219: seconds_to_univ(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  220:     test_seconds_to_univ(ok_utc_seconds()).
  221: 
  222: test_seconds_to_univ([{Datetime, Seconds}|DSs]) ->
  223:     io:format("universaltime = ~p <- seconds = ~p", [Datetime, Seconds]),
  224:     Datetime = erlang:posixtime_to_universaltime(Seconds),
  225:     test_seconds_to_univ(DSs);
  226: test_seconds_to_univ([]) -> 
  227:     ok.
  228: 
  229: 
  230: %% Test that the the different time functions return
  231: %% consistent results.
  232: consistency(_Config) ->
  233:     %% Test that:
  234:     %% 	 * date() & time() gives the same time as erlang:localtime()
  235:     %%
  236:     %%   * the difference between erlang:universaltime() and
  237:     %%     erlang:localtime() is reasonable (with assuming any
  238:     %%     particular timezone)
  239: 
  240:     ok = compare_date_time_and_localtime(16),
  241:     compare_local_and_universal(16).
  242: 
  243: compare_date_time_and_localtime(Times) when Times > 0 ->
  244:     {Year, Mon, Day} = date(),
  245:     {Hour, Min, Sec} = time(),
  246:     case erlang:localtime() of
  247: 	{{Year, Mon, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}} -> ok;
  248: 	_ -> compare_date_time_and_localtime(Times-1)
  249:     end;
  250: compare_date_time_and_localtime(0) ->
  251:     error.
  252: 
  253: compare_local_and_universal(Times) when Times > 0 ->
  254:     Utc = erlang:universaltime(),
  255:     Local = erlang:localtime(),
  256:     io:format("local = ~p, utc = ~p", [Local,Utc]),
  257: 
  258:     AcceptableDiff = 14*3600,
  259:     case linear_time(Utc) - linear_time(Local) of
  260: 	Diff when abs(Diff) < AcceptableDiff ->
  261: 	    ok;
  262: 	Diff ->
  263: 	    io:format("More than ~p seconds difference between "
  264: 		      "local and universal time", [Diff]),
  265: 	    ct:fail(huge_diff)
  266:     end.
  267: 
  268: %% This function converts a date and time to a linear time.
  269: %% Two linear times can be subtracted to give their difference
  270: %% in seconds.
  271: %%
  272: %% XXX Limitations: Simplified leap year calc will fail for 2100 :-)
  273: 
  274: linear_time({{Year, Mon, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}}) ->
  275:     86400*(year_to_days(Year) + month_to_days(Year,Mon) + (Day-1)) +
  276: 	3600*Hour + 60*Min + Sec.
  277: 
  278: year_to_days(Year) ->
  279:     Year * 365 + (Year-1) div 4.
  280: 
  281: month_to_days(Year, Mon) ->
  282:     DoM = [31,days_in_february(Year),31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31],
  283:     {PastMonths,_} = lists:split(Mon-1, DoM),
  284:     lists:sum(PastMonths).
  285: 
  286: days_in_february(Year) ->
  287:     case (Year rem 4) of
  288: 	0 -> 29;
  289: 	_ -> 28
  290:     end.
  291: 
  292: %% Test (the bif) os:timestamp/0, which is something quite like, but not
  293: %% similar to erlang:now...
  294: 
  295: %% Test that os:timestamp works.
  296: timestamp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  297:     try
  298: 	repeating_timestamp_check(100000)
  299:     catch
  300: 	throw : {fail, Failure} ->
  301: 	    %%
  302: 	    %% Our time warping test machines currently warps
  303: 	    %% time every 6:th second. If we get a warp during
  304: 	    %% 10 seconds, assume this is a time warping test
  305: 	    %% and ignore the failure.
  306: 	    %%
  307: 	    case had_time_warp(10) of
  308: 		true ->
  309: 		    {skip, "Seems to be time warp test run..."};
  310: 		false ->
  311: 		    ct:fail(Failure)
  312: 	    end
  313:     end.
  314: 
  315: os_system_time_offset() ->
  316:     erlang:convert_time_unit(os:system_time() - erlang:monotonic_time(),
  317: 			     native, microsecond).
  318: 
  319: had_time_warp(Secs) ->
  320:     had_time_warp(os_system_time_offset(), Secs).
  321: 
  322: had_time_warp(_OrigOffs, 0) ->
  323:     false;
  324: had_time_warp(OrigOffs, N) ->
  325:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  326:     case OrigOffs - os_system_time_offset() of
  327: 	Diff when Diff > 500000; Diff < -500000 ->
  328: 	    true;
  329: 	_Diff ->
  330: 	    had_time_warp(OrigOffs, N-1)
  331:     end.
  332: 
  333: repeating_timestamp_check(0) ->
  334:     ok;
  335: repeating_timestamp_check(N) ->
  336:     {A,B,C} = TS = os:timestamp(),
  337:     if
  338: 	is_integer(A),
  339: 	is_integer(B),
  340: 	is_integer(C),
  341: 	B < 1000000,
  342: 	C < 1000000 ->
  343: 	    ok;
  344: 	true ->
  345: 	    ct:fail("Strange return from os:timestamp/0 ~w~n",[TS])
  346:     end,
  347:     %% I assume the now and timestamp should not differ more than 1 hour,
  348:     %% which is safe assuming the system has not had a large time-warp
  349:     %% during the testrun...
  350:     Secs = A*1000000+B+round(C/1000000),
  351:     {NA,NB,NC} = erlang:now(),
  352:     NSecs = NA*1000000+NB+round(NC/1000000),
  353:     case Secs - NSecs of
  354: 	TooLarge when TooLarge > 3600 ->
  355: 	    throw({fail,
  356: 	       lists:flatten(
  357: 		io_lib:format("os:timestamp/0 is ~w s more than erlang:now/0",
  358: 			     [TooLarge]))});
  359: 	TooSmall when TooSmall < -3600 ->
  360: 	    throw({fail,
  361: 	      lists:flatten(
  362: 		io_lib:format("os:timestamp/0 is ~w s less than erlang:now/0",
  363: 			     [-TooSmall]))});
  364: 	_ ->
  365: 	    ok
  366:     end,
  367:     repeating_timestamp_check(N-1).
  368: 	    
  369: 
  370: %% Test now/0.
  371: 
  372: 
  373: %% Tests that successive calls to now/0 returns different values.
  374: %% Also returns a comment string with the median difference between
  375: %% times (in microseconds).
  376: 
  377: now_unique(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  378:     now_unique(1000, now(), []),
  379:     fast_now_unique(100000, now()).
  380: 
  381: now_unique(N, Previous, Result) when N > 0 ->
  382:     case now() of
  383: 	      Previous ->
  384: 		  ct:fail("now/0 returned the same value twice");
  385: 	      New ->
  386: 		  now_unique(N-1, New, [New|Result])
  387: 	  end;
  388: now_unique(0, _, [Then|Rest]) ->
  389:     now_calc_increment(Rest, microsecs(Then), []).
  390: 
  391: now_calc_increment([Then|Rest], Previous, _Result) ->
  392:     This = microsecs(Then),
  393:     now_calc_increment(Rest, This, [Previous-This]);
  394: now_calc_increment([], _, Differences) ->
  395:     {comment, "Median increment: " ++ integer_to_list(median(Differences))}.
  396: 
  397: fast_now_unique(0, _) -> ok;
  398: fast_now_unique(N, Then) ->
  399:     case now() of
  400: 	Then ->
  401: 	    ct:fail("now/0 returned the same value twice");
  402: 	Now ->
  403: 	    fast_now_unique(N-1, Now)
  404:     end.
  405: 
  406: median(Unsorted_List) ->
  407:     Length = length(Unsorted_List),
  408:     List = lists:sort(Unsorted_List),
  409:     case Length rem 2 of
  410: 	0 ->					% Even length.
  411: 	    [A, B] = lists:nthtail((Length div 2)-1, List),
  412: 	    (A+B)/2;
  413: 	1 ->					% Odd list length.
  414: 	    lists:nth((Length div 2)+1, List)
  415:     end.
  416: 
  417: microsecs({Mega_Secs, Secs, Microsecs}) ->
  418:     (Mega_Secs*1000000+Secs)*1000000+Microsecs.
  419: 
  420: %% Test that the time differences returned by two calls to
  421: %% now/0 one second apart is comparable to the difference of two
  422: %% calls to erlang:localtime().
  423: 
  424: now_update(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     case test_server:is_debug() of
  426: 	false -> now_update1(10);
  427: 	true -> {skip,"Unreliable in DEBUG build"}
  428:     end.
  429: 
  430: 
  431: now_update1(N) when N > 0 ->
  432:     T1_linear = linear_time(erlang:localtime()),
  433:     T1_now = microsecs(now()),
  434: 
  435:     receive after 1008 -> ok end,
  436: 
  437:     T2_linear = linear_time(erlang:localtime()),
  438:     T2_now = microsecs(now()),
  439: 
  440:     Linear_Diff = (T2_linear-T1_linear)*1000000,
  441:     Now_Diff = T2_now-T1_now,
  442:     io:format("Localtime diff = ~p; now() diff = ~p", [Linear_Diff, Now_Diff]),
  443:     case abs(Linear_Diff - Now_Diff) of
  444: 	      Abs_Delta when Abs_Delta =< 40000 -> ok;
  445: 	      _ -> now_update1(N-1)
  446: 	  end;
  447: now_update1(0) ->
  448:     ct:fail("now_update zero").
  449: 
  450: time_warp_modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     %% All time warp modes always supported in
  452:     %% combination with no time correction...
  453:     check_time_warp_mode(false, no_time_warp),
  454:     check_time_warp_mode(false, single_time_warp),
  455:     check_time_warp_mode(false, multi_time_warp),
  456: 
  457:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  458:     try
  459: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  460: 					    true, no_time_warp}) of
  461: 	    false -> ok;
  462: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, no_time_warp)
  463: 	end,
  464: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  465: 					    true, single_time_warp}) of
  466: 	    false -> ok;
  467: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, single_time_warp)
  468: 	end,
  469: 	case erts_debug:get_internal_state({check_time_config,
  470: 					    true, multi_time_warp}) of
  471: 	    false -> ok;
  472: 	    true -> check_time_warp_mode(true, multi_time_warp)
  473: 	end
  474:     after
  475: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
  476:     end.
  477: 
  478: check_time_warp_mode(TimeCorrection, TimeWarpMode) ->
  479:     io:format("~n~n~n***** Testing TimeCorrection=~p TimeWarpMode=~p *****~n",
  480: 	      [TimeCorrection, TimeWarpMode]),
  481:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  482:     _ = erlang:time_offset(),
  483:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(1000),
  484:     MonotonicityTimeout = 2000,
  485:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+c", atom_to_list(TimeCorrection), "+C", atom_to_list(TimeWarpMode)]),
  486:     StartTime = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [start_time]),
  487:     Me = self(),
  488:     MonotincityTestStarted = make_ref(),
  489:     MonotincityTestDone = make_ref(),
  490:     spawn_link(Node,
  491: 	       fun () ->
  492: 		       Me ! MonotincityTestStarted,
  493: 		       cmp_times(erlang:start_timer(MonotonicityTimeout,
  494: 						    self(),
  495: 						    timeout),
  496: 				 erlang:monotonic_time()),
  497: 		       Me ! MonotincityTestDone
  498: 	       end),
  499:     receive MonotincityTestStarted -> ok end,
  500:     check_time_offset(Node, TimeWarpMode),
  501:     TimeWarpMode = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_warp_mode]),
  502:     TimeCorrection = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_correction]),
  503:     receive MonotincityTestDone -> ok end,
  504:     MonotonicTime = rpc:call(Node, erlang, monotonic_time, []),
  505:     MonotonicTimeUnit = rpc:call(Node,
  506: 				       erlang,
  507: 				       convert_time_unit,
  508: 				       [1, second, native]),
  509:     UpMilliSeconds = erlang:convert_time_unit(MonotonicTime - StartTime,
  510: 					      MonotonicTimeUnit,
  511: 					      millisecond),
  512:     io:format("UpMilliSeconds=~p~n", [UpMilliSeconds]),
  513:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
  514:     peer:stop(Peer),
  515:     try
  516: 	true = (UpMilliSeconds > (98*MonotonicityTimeout) div 100),
  517: 	true = (UpMilliSeconds < (102*(End-Start)) div 100)
  518:     catch
  519: 	error:_ ->
  520: 	    io:format("Uptime inconsistency", []),
  521: 	    case {TimeCorrection, erlang:system_info(time_correction)} of
  522: 		{true, true} ->
  523: 		    ct:fail(uptime_inconsistency);
  524: 		{true, false} ->
  525: 		    _ = erlang:time_offset(),
  526: 		    receive
  527: 			{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, _} ->
  528: 			    ignore
  529: 		    after 1000 ->
  530: 			    ct:fail(uptime_inconsistency)
  531: 		    end;
  532: 		_ ->
  533: 		    ignore
  534: 	    end
  535:     end,
  536:     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
  537:     ok.
  538: 
  539: check_time_offset(Node, no_time_warp) ->
  540:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  541:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  542:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]);
  543: check_time_offset(Node, single_time_warp) ->
  544:     preliminary = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  545:     preliminary = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  546:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  547:     final = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]);
  548: check_time_offset(Node, multi_time_warp) ->
  549:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]),
  550:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_flag, [time_offset, finalize]),
  551:     volatile = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [time_offset]).
  552: 
  553: monotonic_time_monotonicity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     Done = erlang:start_timer(10000,self(),timeout),
  555:     cmp_times(Done, erlang:monotonic_time()).
  556: 
  557: cmp_times(Done, X0) ->
  558:     X1 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  559:     X2 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  560:     X3 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  561:     X4 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  562:     X5 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  563:     true = (X0 =< X1),
  564:     true = (X1 =< X2),
  565:     true = (X2 =< X3),
  566:     true = (X3 =< X4),
  567:     true = (X4 =< X5),
  568:     receive
  569: 	{timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  570: 	    ok
  571:     after 0 ->
  572: 	    cmp_times(Done, X5)
  573:     end.
  574: 
  575: -define(NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS, 100000).
  576: 
  577: monotonic_time_monotonicity_parallel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  578:     Me = self(),
  579:     Result = make_ref(),
  580:     Go = make_ref(),
  581:     UpAndRunning = make_ref(),
  582:     NoOnlnScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  583:     OffsetUI = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
  584:     OffsetMT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  585:     MinHSz = ?NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS*(2
  586: 				     + 3
  587: 				     + erts_debug:flat_size(OffsetUI)
  588: 				     + erts_debug:flat_size(OffsetMT)),
  589:     Ps = lists:map(
  590: 	   fun (Sched) ->
  591: 		   spawn_opt(
  592: 		     fun () ->
  593: 			     Me ! {self(), UpAndRunning},
  594: 			     receive Go -> ok end,
  595: 			     Res = fetch_monotonic(?NR_OF_MONOTONIC_CALLS, []),
  596: 			     Me ! {self(), Result, Sched, Res}
  597: 		     end,
  598: 		     [{scheduler, Sched},
  599: 		      {priority, max},
  600: 		      {min_heap_size, MinHSz}])
  601: 	   end,
  602: 	   lists:seq(1, NoOnlnScheds)),
  603:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> receive {P, UpAndRunning} -> ok end end, Ps),
  604:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> P ! Go end, Ps),
  605:     TMs = recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, NoOnlnScheds, []),
  606:     true = check_monotonic_result(TMs, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, true).
  607: 
  608: check_monotonic_result([{_Sched, _PrevUI, _MT, _PostUI}],
  609: 		       _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, Res) ->
  610:     Res;
  611: check_monotonic_result([{_ASched, _APrevUI, AMT, APostUI} = A,
  612: 			{_BSched, BPrevUI, BMT, _BPostUI} = B | _] = L,
  613: 		       OffsetMT, OffsetUI, Res) ->
  614:     NewRes = case (AMT =< BMT) orelse (BPrevUI < APostUI) of
  615: 		 true ->
  616: 		     Res;
  617: 		 false ->
  618: 		     io:format("INCONSISTENCY: ~p ~p~n", [A, B]),
  619: 		     false
  620: 	     end,
  621:     check_monotonic_result(tl(L), OffsetMT, OffsetUI, NewRes).
  622: 
  623: recv_monotonics(_Result, _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, 0, Acc) ->
  624:     lists:keysort(2, Acc);
  625: recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, N, Acc) ->
  626:     receive
  627: 	{_, Result, Sched, Res} ->
  628: 	    CRes = convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, Res, []),
  629: 	    recv_monotonics(Result, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, N-1, CRes ++ Acc)
  630:     end.
  631: 
  632: convert_monotonic(_Sched, _OffsetMT, _OffsetUI, [{_MT, _UI}], Acc) ->
  633:     Acc;
  634: convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI,
  635: 		  [{MT, UI}, {_PrevMT, PrevUI} | _] = L, Acc) ->
  636:     convert_monotonic(Sched, OffsetMT, OffsetUI, tl(L),
  637: 		      [{Sched, PrevUI-OffsetUI, MT-OffsetMT, UI-OffsetUI}
  638: 		       | Acc]).
  639: 
  640: fetch_monotonic(0, Acc) ->
  641:     Acc;
  642: fetch_monotonic(N, Acc) ->
  643:     MT = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  644:     UI = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic]),
  645:     fetch_monotonic(N-1, [{MT, UI} | Acc]).
  646: 
  647: -define(CHK_RES_CONVS_TIMEOUT, 400).
  648: 
  649: time_unit_conversion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  650:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  651:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 1000000000000),
  652:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 2333333333333),
  653:     start_check_res_convs(Mon, 5732678356789),
  654:     erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]).
  655:     
  656: start_check_res_convs(Mon, Res) ->
  657:     io:format("Checking ~p time_unit~n", [Res]),
  658:     check_res_convs(Mon,
  659: 		    erlang:start_timer(?CHK_RES_CONVS_TIMEOUT,
  660: 				       self(),
  661: 				       timeout),
  662: 		    Res).
  663:     
  664: 
  665: check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res) ->
  666:     receive
  667: 	{timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  668: 	    case Res div 10 of
  669: 		0 ->
  670: 		    ok;
  671: 		NewRes ->
  672: 		    start_check_res_convs(Mon, NewRes)
  673: 	    end
  674:     after 0 ->
  675: 	    do_check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res)
  676:     end.
  677: 
  678: do_check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res) ->
  679:     TStart = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  680:     T = erlang:monotonic_time(Res),
  681:     TEnd = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  682:     TMin = erlang:convert_time_unit(TStart, native, Res),
  683:     TMax = erlang:convert_time_unit(TEnd, native, Res),
  684:     %io:format("~p =< ~p =< ~p~n", [TMin, T, TEnd]),
  685:     true = (TMin =< T),
  686:     true = (TMax >= T),
  687:     check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res),
  688:     check_res_convs(Mon, Done, Res).
  689: 
  690: 
  691: check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res) ->
  692:     TORes = erlang:time_offset(Res),
  693:     TO = erlang:time_offset(),
  694:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(TO, native, Res) of
  695: 	TORes ->
  696: 	    ok;
  697: 	TORes2 ->
  698: 	    case check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 1000) of
  699: 		{TO, false} ->
  700: 		    ct:fail({time_unit_conversion_inconsistency,
  701: 			     TO, TORes, TORes2});
  702: 		{_NewTO, true} ->
  703: 		    io:format("time_offset changed", []),
  704: 		    check_time_offset_res_conv(Mon, Res)
  705: 	    end
  706:     end.
  707: 
  708: signed_time_unit_conversion(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1000000),
  710:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1000),
  711:     chk_strc(1000000000, 1),
  712:     chk_strc(1000000, 1000),
  713:     chk_strc(1000000, 1),
  714:     chk_strc(1000, 1),
  715:     chk_strc(4711, 17),
  716:     chk_strc(1 bsl 10, 1),
  717:     chk_strc(1 bsl 16, 10),
  718:     chk_strc(1 bsl 17, 1 bsl 8),
  719:     chk_strc((1 bsl 17) + 1, (1 bsl 8) - 1),
  720:     chk_strc(1 bsl 17, 11),
  721:     ok.
  722: 
  723: chk_strc(Res0, Res1) ->
  724:     case (Res0 /= Res1) andalso (Res0 =< 1000000) andalso (Res1 =< 1000000) of
  725: 	true ->
  726: 	    {FromRes, ToRes} = case Res0 > Res1 of
  727: 				   true -> {Res0, Res1};
  728: 				   false -> {Res1, Res0}
  729: 			       end,
  730: 	    MinFromValuesPerToValue = FromRes div ToRes,
  731: 	    MaxFromValuesPerToValue = ((FromRes-1) div ToRes)+1,
  732: 	    io:format("~p -> ~p [~p, ~p]~n",
  733: 		      [FromRes, ToRes,
  734: 		       MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue]),
  735: 	    chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  736: 				 -10*FromRes, 10*FromRes,
  737: 				 MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  738: 				 MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  739: 				 undefined, MinFromValuesPerToValue);
  740: 	_ ->
  741: 	    ok
  742:     end,
  743:     chk_random_values(Res0, Res1),
  744:     chk_random_values(Res1, Res0),
  745:     ok.
  746: 
  747: chk_random_values(FR, TR) ->
  748:     io:format("rand values ~p -> ~p~n", [FR, TR]),
  749:     rand:seed(exsplus, {268438039,268440479,268439161}),
  750:     Values = lists:map(fun (_) -> rand:uniform(1 bsl 65) - (1 bsl 64) end,
  751: 		       lists:seq(1, 100000)),
  752:     CheckFun = fun (V) ->
  753:                        CV = erlang:convert_time_unit(V, FR, TR),
  754:                        case {(FR*CV) div TR =< V,
  755:                              (FR*(CV+1)) div TR >= V} of
  756:                            {true, true} ->
  757:                                ok;
  758:                            Failure ->
  759:                                ct:fail({Failure, CV, V, FR, TR})
  760:                        end
  761:                end,
  762:     lists:foreach(CheckFun, Values).
  763: 		       
  764: 
  765: chk_values_per_value(_FromRes, _ToRes,
  766: 	 EndValue, EndValue,
  767: 	 MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  768: 	 _ToValue, FromValueCount) ->
  769: %    io:format("~p [~p]~n", [EndValue, FromValueCount]),
  770:     case ((MinFromValuesPerToValue =< FromValueCount)
  771: 	  andalso (FromValueCount =< MaxFromValuesPerToValue)) of
  772: 	false ->
  773: 	    ct:fail({MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  774: 		     FromValueCount,
  775: 		     MaxFromValuesPerToValue});
  776: 	true ->
  777: 	    ok
  778:     end;
  779: chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes, Value, EndValue,
  780: 		     MinFromValuesPerToValue, MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  781: 		     ToValue, FromValueCount) ->
  782:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(Value, FromRes, ToRes) of
  783:         ToValue ->
  784:             chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  785:                                  Value+1, EndValue,
  786:                                  MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  787:                                  MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  788:                                  ToValue, FromValueCount+1);
  789:         NewToValue ->
  790:             case ((MinFromValuesPerToValue =< FromValueCount)
  791:                   andalso (FromValueCount =< MaxFromValuesPerToValue)) of
  792:                 false ->
  793:                     ct:fail({MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  794:                              FromValueCount,
  795:                              MaxFromValuesPerToValue});
  796:                 true ->
  797:                     %		    io:format("~p -> ~p [~p]~n",
  798:                     %			      [Value, NewToValue, FromValueCount]),
  799:                     chk_values_per_value(FromRes, ToRes,
  800:                                          Value+1, EndValue,
  801:                                          MinFromValuesPerToValue,
  802:                                          MaxFromValuesPerToValue,
  803:                                          NewToValue, 1)
  804:             end
  805:     end.
  806: 
  807: erlang_timestamp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  808:     Mon = erlang:monitor(time_offset, clock_service),
  809:     {TO, _} = check_time_offset_change(Mon,
  810: 				       erlang:time_offset(),
  811: 				       0),
  812:     Done = erlang:start_timer(10000,self(),timeout),
  813:     ok = check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO).
  814: 
  815: check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO) ->
  816:     receive
  817:         {timeout, Done, timeout} ->
  818:             erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
  819:             ok
  820:     after 0 ->
  821:               do_check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO)
  822:     end.
  823: 
  824: do_check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, TO) ->
  825:     MinMon = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  826:     {MegaSec, Sec, MicroSec} = erlang:timestamp(),
  827:     MaxMon = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  828:     TsMin = erlang:convert_time_unit(MinMon+TO,
  829: 				     native,
  830: 				     microsecond),
  831:     TsMax = erlang:convert_time_unit(MaxMon+TO,
  832: 				     native,
  833: 				     microsecond),
  834:     TsTime = (MegaSec*1000000+Sec)*1000000+MicroSec,
  835:     case (TsMin =< TsTime) andalso (TsTime =< TsMax) of
  836: 	true ->
  837: 	    NewTO = case erlang:time_offset() of
  838: 			TO ->
  839: 			    TO;
  840: 			_ ->
  841: 			    check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 0)
  842: 		    end,
  843: 	    check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, NewTO);
  844: 	false ->
  845: 	    io:format("TsMin=~p TsTime=~p TsMax=~p~n", [TsMin, TsTime, TsMax]),
  846: 	    io:format("Detected inconsistency; "
  847: 		      "checking for time_offset change...", []),
  848: 	    case check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, 1000) of
  849: 		{TO, false} ->
  850: 		    ct:fail(timestamp_inconsistency);
  851: 		{NewTO, true} ->
  852: 		    io:format("time_offset changed", []),
  853: 		    check_erlang_timestamp(Done, Mon, NewTO)
  854: 	    end
  855:     end.
  856: 
  857: check_time_offset_change(Mon, TO, Wait) ->
  858:     process_changed_time_offset(Mon, TO, false, Wait).
  859: 
  860: process_changed_time_offset(Mon, TO, Changed, Wait) ->
  861:     receive
  862: 	{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, NewTO} ->
  863: 	    process_changed_time_offset(Mon, NewTO, true, Wait)
  864:     after Wait ->
  865: 	    case erlang:time_offset() of
  866: 		TO ->
  867: 		    {TO, Changed};
  868: 		_OtherTO ->
  869: 		    receive
  870: 			{'CHANGE', Mon, time_offset, clock_service, NewTO} ->
  871: 			    process_changed_time_offset(Mon, NewTO, true, Wait)
  872: 		    end
  873: 	    end
  874:     end.
  875:     
  876: 
  877: native_time_unit_gh6165(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     %% This test could potentially fail even when no bug exists if
  879:     %% run during heavy load, or if OS system time or Erlang system time
  880:     %% is changed at an unfortunate time, but it is hard to make the test
  881:     %% more stable than this without losing actual testing...
  882: 
  883:     ChkDiff = fun (Val) ->
  884:                       case erlang:convert_time_unit(Val, native, nanosecond) of
  885:                           Ns when -1000000 < Ns andalso Ns < 1000000 ->
  886:                               erlang:display({diff, Ns}),
  887:                               ok;
  888:                           Ns ->
  889:                               erlang:display({large_diff, Ns}),
  890:                               ct:fail({large_diff, Ns})
  891:                       end
  892:               end,
  893:     
  894:     process_flag(priority, max),
  895: 
  896:     erlang:yield(),
  897:     V1 = erlang:monotonic_time(native) - erlang:monotonic_time(),
  898:     ChkDiff(V1),
  899: 
  900:     erlang:yield(),
  901:     V2 = erlang:system_time(native) - erlang:system_time(),
  902:     ChkDiff(V2),
  903: 
  904:     erlang:yield(),
  905:     V3 = os:system_time(native) - os:system_time(),
  906:     ChkDiff(V3),
  907:     
  908:     erlang:yield(),
  909:     0 = erlang:time_offset() - erlang:time_offset(native),
  910: 
  911:     ok.
  912: 
  913: %% Returns the test data: a list of {Utc, Local} tuples.
  914: 
  915: test_data() ->
  916:     {TZ,DSTTZ} = 
  917: 	case os:type() of
  918: 	    {unix,_} ->
  919: 		case os:cmd("date '+%Z'") of
  920: 		    "SAST"++_ ->
  921: 			{2,2};
  922:                     "PDT"++_ ->
  923:                         {-8,-7};
  924:                     "PST"++_ ->
  925:                         {-8,-7};
  926:                     "UTC"++_ ->
  927:                         {0,0};
  928: 		    _ ->
  929: 			{?timezone,?dst_timezone}
  930: 		end;
  931: 	    _ ->
  932: 		{?timezone,?dst_timezone}
  933: 	end,
  934:     test_data(nondst_dates(), TZ) ++
  935: 	test_data(dst_dates(), DSTTZ) ++
  936: 	crossover_test_data(crossover_dates(), TZ).    
  937: 
  938: 
  939: %% test_data1() ->
  940: %%     test_data(nondst_dates(), ?timezone) ++
  941: %% 	test_data(dst_dates(), ?dst_timezone) ++
  942: %% 	crossover_test_data(crossover_dates(), ?timezone).
  943: 
  944: crossover_test_data([{Year, Month, Day}|Rest], TimeZone) when TimeZone > 0 ->
  945:     Hour = 23,
  946:     Min = 35,
  947:     Sec = 55,
  948:     Utc = {{Year, Month, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  949:     Local = {{Year, Month, Day+1}, {Hour+TimeZone-24, Min, Sec}},
  950:     [{Utc, Local}|crossover_test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  951: crossover_test_data([{Year, Month, Day}|Rest], TimeZone) when TimeZone < 0 ->
  952:     Hour = 0,
  953:     Min = 23,
  954:     Sec = 12,
  955:     Utc = {{Year, Month, Day}, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  956:     Local = {{Year, Month, Day-1}, {Hour+TimeZone+24, Min, Sec}},
  957:     [{Utc, Local}|crossover_test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  958: crossover_test_data([], _) ->
  959:     [].
  960: 
  961: test_data([Date|Rest], TimeZone) ->
  962:     Hour = 12,
  963:     Min = 45,
  964:     Sec = 7,
  965:     Utc = {Date, {Hour, Min, Sec}},
  966:     Local = {Date, {Hour+TimeZone, Min, Sec}},
  967:     [{Utc, Local}|test_data(Rest, TimeZone)];
  968: test_data([], _) ->
  969:     [].
  970:     
  971: nondst_dates() ->
  972:     [{1996, 01, 30},
  973:      {1997, 01, 30},
  974:      {1998, 01, 30},
  975:      {1999, 01, 30},
  976:      {1996, 02, 29},
  977:      {1997, 02, 28},
  978:      {1998, 02, 28},
  979:      {1999, 02, 28},
  980:      {1996, 03, 2},
  981:      {1997, 03, 2},
  982:      {1998, 03, 2},
  983:      {1999, 03, 2}].
  984: 
  985: dst_dates() ->
  986:     [{1996, 06, 1},
  987:      {1997, 06, 2},
  988:      {1998, 06, 3},
  989:      {1999, 06, 4}].
  990: 
  991: %% exakt utc {date(), time()} which corresponds to the same seconds since 1 jan 1970 
  992: %% negative seconds are ok
  993: %% generated with date --date='1979-05-28 12:30:35 UTC' +%s
  994: ok_utc_seconds() -> [
  995: 	{ {{1970, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 0}},            0 },
  996: 	{ {{1970, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 1}},            1 },
  997: 	{ {{1969,12,31},{23,59,59}},           -1 },
  998: 	{ {{1920,12,31},{23,59,59}},  -1546300801 },
  999: 	{ {{1600,02,19},{15,14,08}}, -11671807552 },
 1000: 	{ {{1979,05,28},{12,30,35}},    296742635 },
 1001: 	{ {{1999,12,31},{23,59,59}},    946684799 },
 1002: 	{ {{2000, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 0}},    946684800 },
 1003: 	{ {{2000, 1, 1},{ 0, 0, 1}},    946684801 },
 1004: 
 1005: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,07}},   2147483647 }, % Sint32 full - 1
 1006: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,08}},   2147483648 }, % Sint32 full
 1007: 	{ {{2038, 1,19},{03,14,09}},   2147483649 }, % Sint32 full + 1
 1008: 
 1009: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,14}},   4294967294 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF - 1
 1010: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,15}},   4294967295 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF
 1011: 	{ {{2106, 2, 7},{ 6,28,16}},   4294967296 }, % Uint32 full  0xFFFFFFFF + 1
 1012: 	{ {{2012,12, 6},{16,28,08}},   1354811288 },
 1013: 	{ {{2412,12, 6},{16,28,08}},  13977592088 }
 1014:     ].
 1015: 
 1016: 
 1017: %% The following dates should not be near the end or beginning of
 1018: %% a month, because they will be used to test when the dates are
 1019: %% different in UTC and local time.
 1020: 
 1021: crossover_dates() ->
 1022:     [{1996, 01, 25},
 1023:      {1997, 01, 25},
 1024:      {1998, 01, 25},
 1025:      {1999, 01, 25},
 1026:      {1996, 02, 27},
 1027:      {1997, 02, 27},
 1028:      {1998, 02, 27},
 1029:      {1999, 02, 27}].
 1030: 
 1031: bad_dates() ->
 1032:     [{{1900, 7, 1}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Year
 1033: 
 1034:      {{1996, 0, 20}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Month
 1035:      {{1996, 13, 20}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1036: 
 1037:      {{1996, 1, 0}, {12, 0, 0}},		% Date
 1038:      {{1996, 1, 32}, {12, 0, 0}},
 1039:      {{1996, 2, 30}, {12, 0, 0}},
